column1: 567D76E3-F4DE-4147-9A11-2B796E2F1887#appfire#941A5A8A-3783-44BC-BF1F-143935EDB206#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-05 16:29:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-05 16:29:11.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#6FF46717-CFD7-4FFF-87B6-BE7C8037D517#appfire#941A5A8A-3783-44BC-BF1F-143935EDB206#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-05 16:29:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-05 16:29:11.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#7CD6DD7A-CCFC-4EA5-93E6-DF79BC26C944#appfire#941A5A8A-3783-44BC-BF1F-143935EDB206#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-05 16:29:11.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-05 16:29:11.0#appfire#1
